body.p:
Danville Ky July 1st 1862
Gov Magoffin,
Sir,

You respited a fine on 22nd of December 1860 imposed on William Griffin by the Police Court of Danville amounting to twenty dollars. The said Griffin an Irishman, insists upon the request in your Excellency to remit the same
I can cheerfully bear evidence to his honesty and integrity and if you can do any thing for him, it will be a great favour to a hard working men, and greatly oblige.
With great respect I am your humble servant
